Articles.Content:
Well somehow it turned out that I was playing 64bit all the time. I was even that stuppid that I downloaded mods that said that they didn't supported 64bit. I noticed it after changing some parameters to get more FPS.

I also tried to change it back to 32bit. But nooo. Ksp needs 7GB ram with all my mods... .

Is it normal that it is stable on linux? Because I am genuinely confused right now.

Edited January 18, 2015 by thomas15v

Please pick a topic title that isn't useless.

As for your question, from what i know it is the win64 version that is an unstable mess, not the linux 64bit ver.

Oh yeah x64 is fine on Linux, all the trouble is on Windows

Just don't worry about it and enjoy your RAM
Only 64 bit Windows version is buggy. Linux version work well (so they say, in my case it crashes whole system). It seems that 32 bit Linux version does not even exist.

Oooh, thank you to clear up my confusion xD.

Please pick a topic title that isn't useless.

As for your question, from what i know it is the win64 version that is an unstable mess, not the linux 64bit ver.

Oke lets fix that. EDIT: Better now XD? Sorry I was confused remember.

Another question. Do I have to redownload ActiveTextureManagement to the 64bit version? It could explain my cloud issue.

Edited January 18, 2015 by thomas15v

Fixed it for you

Edit: heh, reedited

Edited January 18, 2015 by sal_vager

64bit on GNU/Linux is stable, AMDs GPU drivers on GNU/Linux maybe not so much...

The GNU/Linux 32bit build is there & runs just fine assuming you have the 32bit libs it needs. There's no reason to run it though.

IIRC ATM has seperate 64 & 32bit builds, but you won't need it on 64bit anyway.

FWIW, I run 64bit on Debian Sid with an NVIDIA card and I haven't had a single issue with stock or with 6+GB worth of mods

Why is this? Dunno, ask Unity

It's rock stable and no mods that I know of disable themselves on it. The problems are with the Windows 64-bit version of KSP. It's just a lot of people don't even recognise Linux as existing and say "64-bit" when they mean the Windows 64-bit version.

As mentioned, if you have an AMD graphics card you can expect it to underperform on Linux whether you use the proprietary drivers or the free software ones. KSP isn't a demanding game though so I expect a decent AMD GPU will still handle it fine on Linux.

Edited January 18, 2015 by cantab
Its stable but you should read this if you get trouble: http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Linux

It's rock stable and no mods that I know of disable themselves on it. The problems are with the Windows 64-bit version of KSP. It's just a lot of people don't even recognise Linux as existing and say "64-bit" when they mean the Windows 64-bit version.

As mentioned, if you have an AMD graphics card you can expect it to underperform on Linux whether you use the proprietary drivers or the free software ones. KSP isn't a demanding game though so I expect a decent AMD GPU will still handle it fine on Linux.

Thats actually sad lol. I love linux . And I am also happy that this game seems to run better on here than windows. And yeah :/. The only good GPU cards that support linux is nvidea and intel I think.
